summary: serena williams beat sara errani 4-6 7-6(3) 6-3 in the fed cup play-off . the world no 1 eventually won the match to take her career record to 8-0 . williams and alison riske were thrashed 6-0 6-3 in the doubles rubber .

aspect: 1. Serena Williams won her Fed Cup play-off match against Sara Errani on Sunday.
2. The match was an eye-opener for Williams as she struggled on clay.
3. The US were relegated to World Group II after losing the doubles rubber.
4. Williams acknowledged that she was not ready for the claycourt season.
5. The US captain Mary Joe Fernandez said they need to work harder to get back amongst the elite nations.
explain: The core idea of this aspect is that Serena Williams won her Fed Cup play-off match against Sara Errani on Sunday.

The aspect states that the match between Serena Williams and Sara Errani in the Fed Cup play-off was an eye-opener for Williams as she struggled on clay. This means that even though Williams is the world number one, she found it challenging to play on clay, a surface that is new to her. This could be because she is more accustomed to playing on hard courts or because she was facing a skilled opponent, like Errani, who knows how to play well on clay. Overall, the match showed Williams that there is still work to be done to improve her game on clay.

The US tennis team was relegated to World Group II after losing the doubles rubber in the Fed Cup play-off against Italy. The doubles rubber is an important match in Fed Cup play where two players from each team play against each other. In this case, Alison Riske and Serena Williams from the US lost to their Italian opponents. As a result, the US team, who lost the overall match 2-3, was relegated to a lower group in the Fed Cup competition.

The aspect highlights that Serena Williams, despite winning the match against Sara Errani and taking her career record to 8-0, admitted that she was not prepared for the claycourt season. This acknowledgement indicates that even though she won, she still faced challenges and room for improvement in her performance.
Mary Joe Fernandez, the US captain, stated that her team requires more effort to regain its position as one of the top nations in the world.
